fast3d.complex

Class Scene

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.complex.Scene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Illuminatable, Renderable

    public class Scene
extends java.lang.Object
implements Illuminatable
    a class to combine multiple Objects
    the renderable interface is implemented just to make this addable to an universe and to make it detectable by ray tracing
    note: to add this to an universe does not mean to add the objects to the universe, but just to make clicking and selecting work
    although the contained objects can be part of a stringent 3d-scenery, they can be independent
    Author:
    Tim Trense

        dir and up should be orthogonal

        dir - the vector that gives the new forward direction

        public Vector3d[] getVertices()
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
        a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here
        may return null if no vertices are used for whatever reason or the vertices are not known yet
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getVerticesOnce

        Returns:

        See Also:
